Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.AAA_: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating a segment for a visitor
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.AAAIP: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating a segment for IP
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.AAAX_: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating a segment for a person (match id)
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.AAAXH_: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating  a segment for a household id
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.AGI: Key in click url to identify tactic….ie,
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.ALI: 1p user matching, not an acronym sometimes referred to as a fingerprint id.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.AO: Product name is Adaptive Optimization.Sometimes referred to as “Adaptive Audience Optimization”, or “Adaptive Audiences”.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.AOP: Area of practices (Legal). An id based on a page
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.audience_managerAudience Manager: Product name was Omnichannel Audiences or OA, Some may call this Social or Search. This platform enables users to create an audience using a NPI list and send that audience to activation platforms outside of pulsepoint. These include but are not limited to, Meta(Facebook,Instagram…), LinkedIn, X(Twitter), Reddit, Pinterest, Google Search, Youtube, Microsoft Ads (Bing).
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.channel/ch/tokentype: SITE("1"),SEARCH("2"), → ClickMEDIA("3"), → Ad ImpressionEMAIL("4"), → OpenMEDIA_CLICK("5"), → Ad ClickEMAIL_CLICK("6") → ClickSOCIAL(“7”)SOCIAL_Click(“8”)SITE_HEARTBEAT("101") →Sessions, Time SpentSITE_EVENT("102") → Downloads, Video content interaction, …
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.ConceptID/Concept: Medscape contextual categorization of content on medscape.com
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.DefLevels: Identifies the the event that occured, for example an impression or click event, or a blocking event. Reasons for why the event occured are identified in DefLevelReasons.DefLevels
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.DefLevelReasons: Explains the reason why a certain action was taken as identified from the DefLevelshttps://ppinc.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DATA/pages/329810/DefLevelReasons
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.DOOH: Digital out of home impressions. Samsung menu ads
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.trueGAID(AAID) or IDFA: IDFA stands for Identifier for Advertisers, which is a unique ID assigned by Apple to a user's device. Android has its own identifier version called Android Advertising ID (AAID), or Google Advertising ID (GAID). Both use hexadecimal formats, but IDFAs are uppercased while GAIDs are lower.IDFA Example: AB1234CD-E123-12FG-J123GAID Example: abcd123e-a123-bcFG-d123
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.HCM: Health Campaign Managers (Managed account under Life)
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.HCP Explorer: A workspace type within the studio platform that is designed to let users create highly targeted NPI (National Provider Identifier) lists and insights with minimal manual effort. Those NPI lists can be sent to Life, Omnichannel Audiences AKA “Audience Manager”, HCP365 and WebMD’s artemis platform.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.HIPAA: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) is a federal law that required the creation of national standards to protect sensitive patient health information from being disclosed without the patient's consent or knowledge.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.HUID: Hurstic User Identification - Formulated my webmd and medscape as a global identifier for an HCP or person.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.IAB Category: Developed by the Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) – the industry body for digital advertising – IAB categories arestandard classifications that publishers and brands use to categorise web content and, therefore, improve targeting.Full List:https://github.com/InteractiveAdvertisingBureau/Taxonomies/blob/develop/Content%20Taxonomies/Content%20Taxonomy%203.1.tsv
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.KOL: Key Opinion Leaders  (Pharma term of the decision makers)
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.MeSH: MedicalSubjectHeadings - Every medical condition. Sometimes referred to as Health Categories.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.Moments: Sometimes referred to as Contextual, Medscape Moments, Affinity, Topics, Concepts. Essentially the Moments dataset encompasses all user activity for an NPI that occurs on a site. This is categorized into MeSH, IAB Category, Topic and Concept. Its used to measure the type and level of content consumed by an NPI.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.MPC (Market place component): Backend running life - Old buyer portal
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.NPL: Natural Language Processing. All our contextualizers: IAB contextualizer, MeSH contextualizer, Endemic contextualizer and so on
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.OA: Product name was Omnichannel Audiences and will be renamed as “Audience Manager”. Please seeAudience Managerfor details.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.P&T: Pharmacy & Therapeutics -The P&T committee is generally the medical staff committee responsible for managing the formulary system. The P&T committee provides an evalu- ative, educational, and advisory service to the medical staff and organizational administration in all matters pertaining to the use of available medications.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.PHI: ProtectedHealthInformationIs any individually identifiable information, including demographic information, created or received by the Covered Entity (CE) that:Relates to the past, present, or future physical or mental health condition of an individual;The provision of care to an individual; orThe past, present, future payment for the provision of care to an individual
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.PII: Personally Identifiable Information, ie. Email Address, First/Last Name, Phone Number, Physical Address
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.PLD: PhysicianLevelData - Log level event data for an NPI
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.Sequential Messaging: Sometimes referred to as Sequential, Sequential Campaigns. Sequential Messaging is a Campaign Type that automatically delivers creatives in a specific sequence or order, bringing a target audience through a personalized nurture sequence based on their omnichannel engagement with PulsePoint media and/or a brandâ€™s website.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.Studio: Sometimes referred to as Genome Studio, but the product name is Studio.Studio is PulsePoint’s advanced AI-driven audience and data platform. Studio uses Workspace Types which are applications within the platform that fulfill specific use cases. HCP Explorer is an example of one Workspace type.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.Smart NPI Match (checkbox): This “smart” mode specifically considers both cookie and geo for doctors behind the scenesfor example, say they have an npi list of Colorado doctors, but impressions will fire across the entire country. This limits based on NPI Reference Geo as well as the NPI.
Uncategorized Acronyms/Terms.TopicID/Topic: WebMD contextual categorization of content on webmd.com

Clinical Acronyms/Terms.NBRx: New to Brand prescriptions - NPIs who have never written a prescription for the brand, or have not been written the Rx in more than 12 months.
Clinical Acronyms/Terms.ICD-10 Codes: InternationalClassification ofDiseases. These are diagnosis (ICD-10-CM) and procedure (ICD-10-PCS) medical billing codes. Seehttps://www.icd10data.com/for a list
Clinical Acronyms/Terms.NDC: Identifier of a drug.A National Drug Code is a unique 10-digit number that identifies drugs in the United States. The FDA maintains the NDC and uses it to track all drugs that are manufactured, prepared, or processed for commercial distribution
Clinical Acronyms/Terms.CPT: Identifier of a treatment or procedureCurrent Procedural Terminology (CPT) codes are a system of medical codes that identify and describe medical services and procedures.
Clinical Acronyms/Terms.HCPCS (Often used with CPT): The Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) is a collection of codes that represent medical services, supplies, products, and procedures. HCPCS codes are used by insurance companies and Medicare to process health insurance claims.

Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.CPA (Cost-Per-Acquisition): Overall campaign spend divided by number of conversions
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.CPC (Cost Per Click): A metric that measures how much an advertiser pays for each click on their ad
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.CPM (Cost-Per-Mille): A pricing model and metric used in digital advertising to measure the cost of 1,000 ad impressions. It's also known as cost per thousand.
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.CTR (Click-Through Rate): A metric to measure how often people who see an ad end up clicking it (how effective an ad is at driving clicks)
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.Impression: Industry term representing an ad being served to a page
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.Paid Impression: Lenny term representing an ad served on a page via a winning bid from the DSP
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.PG: AProgrammaticGuaranteed (PG) deal is a fixed number of ad impressions that a buyer commits to purchasing at a set price. PG deals are an automated way to buy ads that allows buyers to negotiate directly with publishers.
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.PMP: APrivateMarketplace (PMP) deal is a type of real-time bidding (RTB) auction where a publisher sells premium inventory to a select group of advertisers
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.Reach: Generally speaking, the total number of unique people who got exposed to ad campaign. In 365 reach is calculated at the profession and/or specialty level. Where the digital identified universe is the denominator to the exposed NPIs.But it can also be, out of a targeted NPI list how many NPIs were exposed to your site, or a campaign… That would be more like a targeted reach measure.
Industry AdTech Acronyms/Terms.XT3: XT3is conteXTualizer of version 3. It contains 2 ML NLP models that are multiclass classifiers . One of them (IAB categorizer) classifies pages to IAB categories, another one (healthcategorizer) labels pages with MESH taxonomy descriptor ids. We say "labels", because the nature of the data is such that each example may belong to multiple categories

NPI AssignmentAcronyms/Terms.NPIIDN: Portion of Person assignment but not defined in Life

Platform Terms.Account: An account consists of one or more advertisers
Platform Terms.Advertiser/Brand: An advertiser or brand may belong to more than one account
Platform Terms.Campaign: Created under a specific account and brand. Meaning this is a 1:1 relationship between the account + advertiser
Platform Terms.Creative: Assigned to a line item and can belong to multiple line items and campaigns
Platform Terms.Line Item: Created under a campaign -  A line item can only belong to one campaign
Platform Terms.Tactic: A specific strategy used within a Demand-Side Platform (DSP) to target and reach a desired audience through programmatic advertising, often involving methods like retargeting, contextual targeting, location targeting, audience segmentation, and leveraging first-party data to optimize ad placements across various publisher networks.
Platform Terms.Search Extension Line Item: A line item that supports Search Extension Creatives
Platform Terms.Search Extension Creatives: Displays a creative much like a Google search result, containing a headline, display URL, and description
Platform Terms.Ad Group: This is what a tactic is called under a Search Extension Line ItemThis is also the old name for tactics, so in certain areas like theMPC Debugger, all tactics are called ad groups.
Platform Terms.VisitorGUID or VGUID: PulsePoint’s cookie identifier, if in a mobile application then this will show the IDFA or GAID
